Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Price \Price\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Priced}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Pricing}.] 1. To pay the price of. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
With thine own blood to price his blood. --Spenser. [1913 Webster]
2. To set a price on; to value. See {Prize}. [1913 Webster]
3. To ask the price of; as, to price eggs. [Colloq.] [1913 Webster]
pricing n : the evaluation of something in terms of its price
